name: Easy Call To Action
author: CodingWithMica

sections.description:
Create Call To Actions and generate shortcodes to insert them in post, pages or widgets.

This clean and small plugin let you create a simple Call To Action and give them your own styles without using code.

You can edit:

  • Title
  • Text / description / custom HTML
  • Button
  • Layout
  • And all the styles of them…

Liked Easy Call To Action?

  • You can Buy me a Coffe ‚òïü§ç to help me improve this plugin and create more.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin folder to your /wp-content/plugins/ folder.
  2. Go to the Plugins page and activate the plugin.
  3. Go to the Easy Call To Action‘s tab on your wp-admin sidebar
  4. Start creating with the button Add new
sections.faq:
Can I create any Call To Actions as I want?

Of course, this plugin is completly free, you can add as many as want.

I have suggestions for this plugin

You can send me your suggestions to hello@codingwithmica.com and I’ll be very happy to read them and see if I can improve this plugin.

short_description: Create Call To Actions and generate shortcodes to insert them in post, pages or widgets.
description:
Create Call To Actions and generate shortcodes to insert them in post, pages or widgets.

This clean and small plugin let you create a simple Call To Action and give them your own styles without using code.

You can edit:

  • Title
  • Text / description / custom HTML
  • Button
  • Layout
  • And all the styles of them…

Liked Easy Call To Action?

  • You can Buy me a Coffe ‚òïü§ç to help me improve this plugin and create more.

screenshots.caption: Visual Creator (Creator Part 1) Add each property to give your Call To Action the styles that you want.
(Creator Part 2) You can style the text, button and layout.
(Creator Part 3) And preview your Call To Action as you go.
List of Call To Action created You can add, edit, duplicate or delete your Call To Actions.

Simple to use Once you create your Call To Action, just paste the shortcode into the "Shortcode" block of Gutemberg and save changes (you also can use it in Elementor, Divi, WPBackery and Classic Editor).
Example The width of your Call To Action depends on its container. And the font, will be inherit from your theme.
